page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY BUILDING
page.content: The Birley Arms The Birley Arms Public House has not always been known by this name.The Birleys being mill owners in Kirkham spinning cotton and flax into linen. The Public House situated in a rural surroundings at the junction of Bryning Lane,Hillock Lane and Carr Lane used to be called "The Red Heart."It came by this name because of certain gruesome happenings during the civil war in 1642 . A battle was fought in the field behind the public house where musket balls have since been found.A soldier from Oliver Cromwell's army having killed a Royalist enemy,removed the heart from his body with his spear.He then proceeded to pin the heart above the door of the public house with the Royalist's own dagger.
